downloadKey.nConstituentDatasets: Includes records from {NUMBER_FORMATTED} {NUMBER, select, one{dataset} other{datasets}}
downloadKey.fileNotAvailable: This file is no longer available for download
downloadKey.downloadDeletionWarning: This download hasn't been cited and is eligible for deletion after {DATE}.
downloadKey.nRecordsAtTime: {NUMBER_FORMATED} {NUMBER, select, one{record} other{records}} at time of download
downloadKey.readDatauseAndTerms: Make sure to read the [data user agreement](/terms/data-user) and [citation guidelines](/citation-guidelines).
downloadKey.downloadKilled: The download request was unsuccessful. Please try it again or get in touch.
downloadKey.downloadDeleted: This file has been deleted. If you need it restored then please get in touch.
downloadKey.storageDurationTeaser: For how long will GBIF store this data?
downloadKey.predatesDoi: This download predates our use of DOIs
downloadKey.apiUsageDescription: To repeat the download on todays data using the API you can use below query.
downloadKey.downloadStarted: The download has been started and is currently being processed.
downloadKey.downloadExpectTime: Please expect up to 3 hours for the download to complete. Most downloads will complete within 15 minutes.
downloadKey.notificationEmailAddresses: A notification email with a link to download the results will be sent to the following address once ready:
downloadKey.freeOfCost: Free of cost – not free of responsibilities
downloadKey.promoteTransperant: To promote transparent science and credit data publishers it is important to cite data correctly. You can do so by including the [recommended GBIF citation](https://www.gbif.org/citation-guidelines) in your work, which you will receive together with your requested data.
downloadKey.ifAnalysingData: If you are analysing the data you will download, please consider referencing this citation in your Materials and methods section.
downloadKey.requestingFullDownload: You are requesting a full download of all occurrence data in GBIF.
downloadKey.occFiltersExplainedHere: This is possible, but you may want to filter the data before downloading. This can be done using our occurrence filters. These are explained [here](/news/3K5oLzZXi0yG0SEO8E6c88/top-tip-using-filters-and-facets-on-gbiforg)
downloadKey.estSizeIs: The estimated size of the download is {SIZE_FORMATTED}
downloadKey.onceDownloaded: Once you have downloaded the file, you will need another {SIZE_FORMATTED} of free disk space to unzip the data.
downloadKey.youWillNotBeAble: You will not be able to view or analyse the data in Excel or similar applications. In order to work with these data, you will need knowledge of e.g. R, Python or Relational databases.
downloadKey.difficultToAnalyse: A dataset of this size is difficult to analyse on your normal desktop computer. You will probably need access to some sort of distributed computing service.
